intro: Ruschia langebaanensis, commonly known as the Langebaan bulbous plant, is a species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to rocky and sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
